newsitem.title: CHINA: UNDERWRITER GROUP FORMS FOR CKI LOAN.
newsitem.headline: UNDERWRITER GROUP FORMS FOR CKI LOAN.

text.p: An underwriter group has formed for Cheung Kong Infrastructure Finance Co Ltd's HK$3.8 billion term loan/revolving credit facility, arranger Sumitomo Bank said.
The deal is guaranteed by Cheung Kong Infrastructure Holdings Ltd.
The facility has a final maturity of five years and pays a margin of 39 basis points over the Hong Kong Interbank Offered Rate.
The deal is divided into a HK$2.0 billion term loan, and a HK$1.8 billion revolving credit which converts into a term loan after two and a half years.

Underwriters are BA Asia, CEF Capital, Paribas Asia, Sumitomo Bank, Banque Nationale de Paris's Hong Kong branch, Dai-Ichi Kangyo Bank's Hong Kong branch, Industrial Bank of Japan's Hong Kong branch, Standard Chartered Bank, Banca Commerciale Italiana's Hong Kong branch, Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi, Fuji Bank, Long-Term Credit Bank of Japan and Sakura Bank.
Cheung Kong Infrastructure Holdings Ltd has been assigned an A-minus long-term corporate credit rating by Standard and Poor's Corp.
